Update bip-0039-wordlists.md

events.body: NACK - most of these are rarely used words. Would be better to do some freq analysis and use only well-known/often used words.

As a Dutch native, I have never seen or heard many of the words proposed. Seeds words should be clear and easy to remember. 

Do we really need or want a wordlist for each and every language? I prefer the KISS principle instead.

NACK 

Every additional wordlist added limits the space for subsequent wordlists in other languages. If additional wordlists should be added, languages with more speakers should have priority over those with few.
It is not addressed by existence of Czech wordlist as the situation is not the same. The space for new languages is not the same as when the Czech wordlist was created.

> It is not addressed by existence of Czech wordlist as the situation is not the same. The space for new languages is not the same as when the Czech wordlist was created.

Why there is limited space? What limits number of languages that can be added?

> @AbelLykens Thank you for your input, do you have by any means any suggestion on how to perform a frequency analysis (some tooling?)

I started a bit here: https://github.com/AbelLykens/bip39-nl . It takes words from opensubtitles from 2014 and 2015, gets the most used ones, filters out unique first-four-letter words.

We could work from the resulting 3000+ wordlist (called 4096 but there were not 4096 words) and eliminate bad ones to come to a 2048 word list.

To elaborate, I suggest:

1. Use [this list](https://github.com/AbelLykens/bip39-nl/blob/main/results_4096_sorted.csv) as a start
2. (optional) Copy it to your own repo
3. Clear out all bad words: politically sensitive words, words that look too much alike (like `koop` and `koos`, just 1 letter difference)
4. (optional) submit back to my repo and/or (just) change the list of this PR

events.message:
Update dutch.txt

Revised word list based on the input of @AbelLykens

events.body:
> > It is not addressed by existence of Czech wordlist as the situation is not the same. The space for new languages is not the same as when the Czech wordlist was created.
> 
> Why there is limited space? What limits number of languages that can be added?

The first four characters of seed words must be unique, not just in the language wordlist, but across all language wordlists. Hence, the addition of every new wordlist with latin alphabet characters narrows down the space for unique 4 character combinations. 

See https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/bip-0039-wordlists.md#czech:
> No words already used in other language mnemonic sets (english, italian, french, spanish). Letters with diacritical marks from these sets are counted as analogous letters without diacritical marks.

Also https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039.mediawiki#wordlists 
> Since the vast majority of BIP39 wallets supports only the English wordlist, it is strongly discouraged to use non-English wordlists for generating the mnemonic sentences.
